subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Hi, folks
msgSnippet: ... I have sucessfully gotten this to work. I added them to the /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/Type1 directory. Add this line to the fonts.scale file in the font
messageBody:
On Mon, Aug 12, 2002 at 07:46:01PM -0400, C. Paige Gabhart wrote:
> I am using a hybrid Linux/Windows OS, and have not worked out how to use
> Jerome or a version thereof on my Linux box yet, which in the past few
> months has kept me from sending messages on the site using QS.
I have sucessfully gotten this to work.

I added them to the /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/Type1 directory.
Add this line to the fonts.scale file in the font directory that you
add the file to:
jerome.pfb -unknown-jerome-medium-r-normal--0-0-0-0-p-0-iso10646-1

Add these files to the font directory:
http://www.honors.montana.edu/~jjc/jerome.pfb
http://www.honors.montana.edu/~jjc/jerome.afm

Run mkfontdir in the directory that you installed the fonts.

Get the font server to reread the fonts.
"xset fp rehash" might work.

For more help on installing fonts see the Font howto:
http://www.tldp.org/HOWTO/Font-HOWTO/index.html

--
Josh Cogliati
jjc@...
This message created in Linux, the choice of a GNU generation.
